artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Yamaguchiya Tōbei
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 107; Marks, Genji's World in Japanese Woodblock Prints (2012), p. 221 no. 224, G082-02; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 299
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: three separate sheets; distressed-looking crouching woman at left, wearing grey kimono with orange and yellow flowers along them hem and red flowered obi, holding a green bamboo lantern; standing man at center wearing a kimono with blue, purple and white striped and patterned sleeves and blue body with swirl patterns and orange obi, holding a fan in his PR hand with blue geometric pattern; two women at right--crouching woman wearing dark blue kimono with light blue flowers and standing woman wearing blue kimono fading to pink at hem, and yellow obit with blue and green checks; two other women in background behind man, to his PR; seascape beyond with boats on water and night sky with moon
dimension: 14 1/4 × 10 in. (36.2 × 25.4 cm) (sheet, each, approx., vertical ōban triptych)
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Stylish Genji (Imayō Genji 今様げんじ)
signed: R, L: 魁斎芳年筆 {Kaisai Yoshitoshi hitsu} | C: 玉桜芳年筆 {Gyokuō Yoshitoshi hitsu}
title: Distant view of Yokohama from the Daikokurō Restaurant at Kanagawa
